about_the_game:
The Philotes Trials is a competition that exists to bring harmony to the world. Every year, different species are randomly selected and grouped together to participate in these trials. Even if they dislike each other, they have to form a bond and build teamwork in order to pass. Will friendships be made? Or will there be something even more blossoming?

Rui (renameable MC) is a human who finds himself in this competition. There, he meets four species from different realms who he has to team up with. As the team leader, he has the responsibility to bring the team together and get to know more about them. At first, he couldn't care less about his teammates, but his mindset for them might change as the days passes.


There are several trials to participate in. Each and every one helps build teamwork.
Pass those trials to get tokens.


With those tokens, unlock one-on-one events with the members of the team. Seeing those events will help build individual bonds with them.


Max out a teammate's affection, and something good might happen.



Teammate 1. Altair comes across as an arrogant vampire. He'll constantly address himself as mighty or great. But behind his arrogance and pride, he's hiding an insecurity.


Teammate 2. Fern is an egocentric elf. Every now and then, he'll always boast about how he's a scholar and put others down for being as unintelligent as him. He thinks making friends is a waste of time, but maybe his behavior reflects his hidden loneliness.


Teammate 3. Lyka is an energetic and loud werewolf. Being the youngest in his large family, he's always treated like a kid. He wishes to become less immature and prove himself to be more reliable.


Teammate 4. Triton is an unhappy merman. Even though he's one of the princes in his kingdom, he doesn't have any confidence in himself because he feels as though he can't live up to his two older brothers. Triton needs someone to make him realize his self-worth and give him confidence.


- 10 trials (mini-games) to participate in
- 40 evening events (1 for each love interest)
- 5 different endings
- Over 50K words
- Over 20 CGs

This game focuses on friendship more than romance
